oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Housing System and Nutrition on Claw Hom Growth and Abrasion in Beef Steers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Becvar, O.
Swecker, W. S.
Ward, D. L.
Scaglia, G.
Neel, J. P. S.
Fontenot, J. P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lameness
economic losses
lesions
claw lesions
concrete flooring
high grain rations
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lameness results in economic losses in cattle populations worldwide. Most lameness lesions are associated with the lower foot, especially the claw. Major risk factors for lesions of the claw are high grain rations and concrete flooring.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 211
